articles.title: Here's what it's like to be on a quarantined cruise ship
articles.description: More than 3,700 people are in quarantine on a cruise ship in Japan, after dozens on board tested positive for the Wuhan coronavirus. Passengers have shared their stories of what life looks like on the ship.

articles.title: Families trying to adopt from China are facing indefinite delays due to coronavirus
articles.description: Americans adopt more children from China than any other country. The State Department has advised all US citizens, including adoptive families, not to travel to China at this time.
articles.content:
(CNN)If everything had gone according to plan, Kristen and Kenny Anderson and their four-year-old daughter Brooklyn would be on their way home from China by now with a new addition to their family: another four-year-old girl whom they've named Hannah.

articles.author: Michelle Toh, CNN Business
articles.title: How China's companies are trying to get back to business
articles.description: China is slowly getting back to work on Monday after the deadly coronavirus outbreak forced many parts of the country to extend the Lunar New Year holiday by more than a week. But it's still far from business as usual in the world's second-largest economy.

articles.title: Food prices are soaring in China because of the coronavirus and swine fever

articles.author: Analysis by James Griffiths and Nectar Gan, CNN
articles.title: Analysis: China's massive security state is being used to crack down on coronavirus
articles.description: As Chinese authorities struggle to contain the deadly Wuhan coronavirus, they are increasingly turning to a sophisticated authoritarian playbook honed over decades of cracking down on dissidents to enforce quarantines and lockdowns across the country.
